content.raw:
I may be confused. In my perspective there are two different users: a user of noise and an implementor of a new type of noise.

In the first case, the user should just specify the noise type in SDF, and Gazebo handles the rest by calling the noise factory.

In the second case, the user should inherit from Noise to define their own noise. In this case we want to make sure that they specify a type, which has lead to this discussion.
content.html:
I may be confused. In my perspective there are two different users: a user of noise and an implementor of a new type of noise.

In the first case, the user should just specify the noise type in SDF, and Gazebo handles the rest by calling the noise factory.

In the second case, the user should inherit from Noise to define their own noise. In this case we want to make sure that they specify a type, which has lead to this discussion.
